tutorial.title: Toggling CSS Classes
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to add, remove, or toggle classes with JavaScript

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
There's a reason why we haven't used setAttribute() to set classes. If we use it to change a class, it overrides the previous class.

We can see the issue if we run this code and try to make the text display as both bold and italic.

Make sure to pick setAttribute.

lessons.title: ClassList Demo
lessons.interactiveContent:
There's a better way to add and remove classes and it's with a property called classList.

Press the buttons to try out different combinations and see it in action first.

lessons.title: Classlist Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
To add a new class without overriding the previous one, first, we have to add the classList property. Then, we can use it to access the add() method.

Make sure to pick . followed by classList and then ., add, (, ).

lessons.title: Adding
lessons.interactiveContent:
Inside the add() method, we code the class we want to add to the element.

Code "bold" to add the class once you call the function.

Make sure to pick ", followed by bold, and finally ".

lessons.title: Remove a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
Classes can be removed from an element as well. To remove a class, code the remove() method .

Make sure to pick remove.

lessons.title: Toggle a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want to automatically add or remove a class when we call the function, we can use the toggle() method.

Run the code and press the button a few times to see it work.

Make sure to pick toggle.

lessons.title: Add Multiple Classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can add multiple classes to an element at the same time. Let's add two new classes to our paragraph element.

Make sure to pick add("highlight", "underline").

lessons.title: Remove Multiple Classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can easily remove multiple classes as well. Remove the highlight and underline classes from our paragraph element.

Make sure to pick "highlight", "underline".

lessons.title: Question: ClassList Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the difference between using classList and setAttribute() to modify an element's classes?

setAttribute() overwrites the element's classes while classList does notclassList overwrites the element's classes while setAttribute() does not

setAttribute() overwrites the element's classes while classList does not.

lessons.title: Question: Add a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which classList method would you use to add a class?

classList.add()classList.remove()

Make sure to pick classList.add().

lessons.title: Question: Remove a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's happening in this code?

The italic class is removed from the selected paragraph elementThe paragraph element is removed from the HTML document

The italic class is removed from the selected paragraph element.

lessons.title: Question: Toggle a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we execute the toggleBold function if the selected element already has the bold class set?

The bold class is removed from the elementNothing happens; the element remains unchanged

The bold class is removed from the element.

lessons.title: Question: Add Multiple Classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when the addClasses function is called?

The bold and underline classes are added to the selected elementThe bold class is added to any element that has an underline class

The bold and underline classes are added to the selected element.

lessons.title: Question: Remove Multiple Classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code?

Multiple classes should be separated by a commaYou can't remove multiple classes at the same time

Multiple classes should be separated by a comma.

lessons.title: Example: ClassList Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
To add the underline class to the selected element, code the classList property.

Make sure to type classList.

lessons.title: Example: Add a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the add() method to add the highlight class to the p element.

Make sure to pick add followed by ( and then "highlight", ).

lessons.title: Example: Remove a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
Remove the highlight class from the selected element by coding the remove() method.

Make sure to type remove.

lessons.title: Example: Toggle a Class
lessons.interactiveContent:
Toggle the bold class by coding toggle("bold").

Make sure to type toggle("bold").

lessons.title: Example: Add Multiple Classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add two new classes to the selected element.

Make sure to pick "underline", "bold".

lessons.title: Example: Remove Multiple Classes
lessons.interactiveContent:
Remove the italic and bold classes.

Make sure to type "italic",.
